meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Let me tell you, I'm excited to dive into Die By The Blade, a samurai fighting game that's got folks talking. Now, I know what you're thinking - another Bushido Blade wannabe? Well, buckle up, friends, because this one's got some... um, let's say, "interesting" elements.

First off, the good stuff: the combat is snappy and fun! You'll be slicing through enemies like a hot knife through butter (or, you know, like a samurai). It's addictive, really. I found myself wanting to fight just one more match... or ten. The swordplay mechanics are solid, with a nice mix of light and heavy attacks. Plus, the art style is visually appealing - think gritty, dark samurai anime.

Now, onto the, ahem, "other" stuff: where do I even start? Well, let's just say that some critics (cough, God is a Geek, cough) were less than thrilled with Die By The Blade. They said it lacks excitement, and I'm like, "Hey, isn't that what samurai games are all about - slow-motion violence?" Kidding aside, there are some serious issues here.

First off, the lack of content is ridiculous. We're talking single-digit hours of gameplay here. That's not even a warm-up for most gamers! The rewards system is also super slow, so you'll be grinding (or should I say, "blade-ing"?) just to unlock new stuff. And don't even get me started on the character design - bland doesn't even begin to describe it.

Now, before all you die-hard Bushido Blade fans out there start shouting, "But what about the spirit of the original game?!" Let me tell you, Die By The Blade is not that. It's more like... well, an early access title marked as a full-fledged release (ahem, GameMAG). Yeah, it needs work.

So, in conclusion, Die By The Blade has some solid core mechanics and addictive combat, but it's severely lacking in content, design, and overall polish. I'm not sure if I'd recommend this one just yet... unless you're a die-hard samurai fighting game fan who doesn't mind a few (dozen) rough edges.

That's my two cents on Die By The Blade. Agree to disagree with me? Let me know in the comments!
